{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks for the option that will not lead to the spread of communicable disease during a disaster. Looking at the options, Diarrhoea, Acute Respiratory infection, and Measles are all communicable diseases that can spread during a disaster due to factors like overcrowding, lack of sanitation, and lack of access to healthcare. However, Malnutrition is not a communicable disease. It is a condition that results from eating a diet in which nutrients are either not enough or are too much such that it causes health problems. It can increase susceptibility to disease, but it is not a disease that can spread from person to person.", "answer_choice": "D"}
